title: IMD forecasts heatwave in Odisha, heavy rain in Arunachal - - NEWS ON AIR
article_text: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecasted heat wave conditions at isolated places over interior Odisha today. Hot and humid conditions are very likely to prevail throughout the day over Coastal Andhra Pradesh and Yanam. The weather department also predicted heavy rainfall or snowfall in parts of Arunachal Pradesh till tomorrow. Pockets of Kerala, Mahe, South Interior Karnataka, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Sub-Himalayan West Bengal, and Sikkim are likely to experience thunderstorms, gusty winds, and lightning today. IMD said places over West Rajasthan can witness dust-raising winds today.

article_text:

Officials Told To Relocate Households In Flood-Prone Areas In Telangana
Telangana
DC Correspondent
13 June 2025 12:10 AM
Revenue minister directs flood-prone districts to prepare action plans by June 30; calls for proactive, tech-integrated disaster management.
Revenue minister Ponguleti Srinivas Reddy (Image:DC)

Hyderabad: Revenue minister Ponguleti Srinivas Reddy directed revenue officials to prepare district-wise flood action plans by June 30 to prevent potential loss of life, property and infrastructure on account of heavy rain and floods during the monsoon. He asked officials to modernise the disaster management department and integrate it with the Integrated Command and Control Centre (ICCC) in Banjara Hills to facilitate real-time alerts and faster response mechanisms during heavy rain and floods.

Also Read - CM Gets Telangana High Court Stay Till June 23 on Defamation Case

In view of predictions for above-normal rainfall this monsoon, Srinivas Reddy sounded a high alert, particularly for the flood-prone Godavari and Krishna river basins. Chairing a review meeting with district collectors at Secretariat on Thursday, the minister said that preparedness must precede emergency, with plans in place to prevent potential loss of life, property and infrastructure.

He cited the damage caused by sudden floods between July and September over the past years and urged officials to permanently relocate vulnerable families. Construction of Indiramma houses is being considered for resettlement, he said.

Also Read - Schools Across Telangana Buzz With Energy As Year Begins Fresh

‚ÄúThe focus should not be on reacting to disasters, but on preventing them,‚Äù he said, calling for swift coordination among departments. A high-powered committee has been formed, comprising top officials from fire services, disaster management, ICCC, irrigation, roads and buildings and health departments. This committee will submit a detailed action plan on the lines of Hyderabad‚Äôs disaster management system within a week.

Also Read - CCLA Mittal Out, Juniors Get Plum Revenue Posts

Revenue principal secretary Navin Mittal, disaster management commissioner S. Harish, fire services DG Y. Nagi Reddy, HYDRAA commissioner A.V. Ranganath, panchayat raj commissioner G. Srijana, southern discom head Musharraf Ali Faruqui, agriculture director B. Gopi, IMD Hyderabad director Dr K. Nagaratna and collectors from Adilabad, Bhadradri Kothagudem, Jogulamba Gadwal, Mulugu, Nirmal and Wanaparthy districts, were present in the meeting.




( Source : Deccan Chronicle )
Revenue Minister Ponguleti Srinivas Reddy¬†Telangana news¬†

Home ¬†>¬†News¬†>¬†Cities¬†>¬†Hyderabad
Flood mgmt: Minister prods officials to be on high alert
The Hans India
Hans News Service | 13 June 2025 10:32 AM IST
HIGHLIGHTS
Hyderabad: In the wake of the Meteorological Department (IMD) warnings that there is a possibility of more than normal rainfall this year, the Revenue...

Hyderabad: In the wake of the Meteorological Department (IMD) warnings that there is a possibility of more than normal rainfall this year, the Revenue Minister Ponguleti Srinivas Reddy has instructed the officials to gear up to face flood like situation and to remain alert to prevent any loss of life or property.

During a high-level review meeting with Collectors in the Secretariat on flood management in the Godavari and Krishna river catchment areas, the Minister suggested that rather than reacting after the damage caused by natural disasters, proactive measures should be taken to prevent damage. He said that a high-level standing committee has been formed with the HYDRAA Commissioner, Fire DG, Disaster Management Commissioner, Command Control Center Director, Commissioners of Irrigation, R&B and Health Departments on the steps to be taken at the state level, mainly in the flood-affected areas.

He said that steps should be taken to strengthen the disaster management department, just like in Hyderabad. This committee will submit a report within a week and action will be taken as per the committee report.
